div.bibl: Russkii Viesnik (Russian Herald), Dec. 18, 1924. RUSSIAN PEOPLE'S INSTITUTE

body.p: At the initiative of the Russian Herald there will be opened in Chicago the Russian People's Institute.
Lectures will be given in this institute on several subjects the study of which is necessary for the Russian colony.
The program of this institute is as follows:
(c) The Art of Writing Correspondence for the Press.
2. The Industrial Structure of America and Europe.
(a) Rights and Duties of American Citizens and Immigrants.
(c) Rights and Duties of Industrial workmen.
4. History and Geography of Russia and America.
7. A Popular Course of Medical Science.
It is planned to begin the lectures at the institute on January, 1925.
Applications may be signed right now at the office of the Russian Herald. Complete information about the institute and the lectures will be given on the pages of the Russian Herald.
